MasterAnswered on 29 Apr 2019Any portfolio designed for an only 5 year return and trying to achieve a net positive can't have a risk profile that's higher than Balanced. In fact, even then - despite all diversified portfolios making money after 10 years, there's still a little risk. So if you've been placed in 80, or 100% equities, the person who you're working with has no idea what they're doing. I would suggest looking out for that.
